body:
Removing the system default protobuf packages solved this issue. The installation for protobuf 3.0 was with the standard configure options. Perhaps the precedence for /usr/local/lib was not right.

Happy to provide more information if someone wants to pursue this. Otherwise OK to close this issue.
Which version of protobuf was installed on the system exactly ?

Package: libprotoc8
Versions:  2.5.0-9ubuntu1 ...

System default was in /usr, and custom install for version 3.0 was in /usr/local.

So, another way to solve that would've been to upgrade protobuf 3.0 in your /usr/local. I'm guessing you had installed a version prior to 3.0.0-alpha3, which is the one required by the current version of gRPC.

I installed from HEAD of the github repo - https://github.com/google/protobuf - as it was yesterday. And later also performed the same install steps from the third_party subdir of the grpc repo in case it was linked to a different version.

I did not have to touch the version in /usr/local in any way to install grpc after removing the version in /usr.
Hmmm, that's as if it was linking against the 2.x version for some reason. We'll investigate.

If an user has two versions of protobuf library installed, it's likely that the "-lprotobuf" linker flags will be pointing to the wrong lib. Seems to me the right solution is to give the user an option to specify the exact location and name of the protobuf library to link with.

Hey @siddharthab, thanks for sharing this. I'm experiencing a very similar problem right now. How do you make sure that the system default protobuf packages have been removed?  For me "protoc --version" produces "libprotoc [new version]", but I'm not sure if it's a good enough indicator that the old version has been deleted.
I believe something like ldconfig can help you figure out which directories have protobuf library installed and in which order they are considered.

In ubuntu 16.04, I have problem from multiple libprotobuf version too, but uninstalling old libprotobuf may not be a good idea.
Here is what I tried because I heard about removing old libprotobuf is "the solution":
`sudo apt-get remove libprotobuf9v5 libprotobuf-lite9v5`

I got:
```

E: Error, pkgProblemResolver::Resolve generated breaks, this may be caused by held packages.
```
I got hesitate because removing old libprotobuf might solve my problem but it will create more problems. Still, I continued with:

`sudo dpkg --remove --force-depends libprotobuf9v5 libprotobuf-lite9v5`

Now, I tried to run my gtk3 + grpc app, but I got an error. And I can reproduce the error by importing gtk3 in python shell like this:

```
>>> import gi
>>> gi.require_version('Gtk', '3.0')
>>> from gi.repository import Gtk as gtk
```

I got:
```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
  File "/opt/crystal/venv/panel/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/gi/importer.py", line 145, in load_module
    importlib.import_module('gi.repository.' + dep.split("-")[0])
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/importlib/__init__.py", line 37, in import_module
    __import__(name)
  File "/opt/crystal/venv/panel/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/gi/importer.py", line 146, in load_module
    dynamic_module = load_overrides(introspection_module)
  File "/opt/crystal/venv/panel/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/gi/overrides/__init__.py", line 125, in load_overrides
    override_mod = importlib.import_module(override_package_name)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/importlib/__init__.py", line 37, in import_module
    __import__(name)
  File "/opt/crystal/venv/panel/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/gi/overrides/Gdk.py", line 80, in <module>
    Color = override(Color)
  File "/opt/crystal/venv/panel/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/gi/overrides/__init__.py", line 206, in override
    assert g_type != TYPE_NONE
AssertionError
```
I ended up reinstalling libprotobuf9v5 libprotobuf-lite9v5 and check around in github. Anyone have any ideas?

i have compiled caffe on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS both with python 2 and python, it is really a hectic process for beginners, for caffe with python 2.7 make sure that your /.local/lib/python2.7/site-packages only contains a version same as you protoc version. protoc version can be checked by entering
`protoc --version`
for me i got problems with python 2.7 because by mistake i installed protbuf 3.0 alpha in python 2.7 site packages, so there was a protobuf error after removing it from python 2.7 site packages everything worked fine
also install python-dev version
`apt-get install the python3.x-dev`
and for python 3.5 make sure you have python 3.0 alpha, if you have both python 2.7 and python 3.x in the system use pip3 otherwise use pip

`pip3 install protobuf==3.0.0-alpha-3`

or another protobuf such as 3.5 version of protobuf.
also do this
`pip3 install python-dateutil --upgrade`
after that do 
`make clean`
`make all`
`make runtest`
`make pycaffe`
after performing make all make runtest steps don't forget to do that
`sudo ldconfig`

hope everything works OK for you.
Due to semantic versioning with protobuf, it's impossible to really have more than one version of protobuf installed.
